meanings.definition: To grant the use of (something) on condition that it or its equivalent will be returned.
meanings.sent1: She lends her bike to her friend for the weekend.
meanings.sent2: The library lends books to students for free.
meanings.sent3: The kind neighbor lends sugar to everyone in the building.
meanings.sent4: His generosity lends a helping hand to those in need.
meanings.sent5: The sun lends its warmth to the flowers in the garden.

meanings.definition: To provide or furnish with something before payment is made.
meanings.sent1: The bank lends money to people who want to buy houses.
meanings.sent2: The shop lends umbrellas to customers on rainy days.
meanings.sent3: The bakery lends a sweet aroma to the street.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lends brightness to the room.
meanings.sent5: The wind lends a cool breeze on a hot summer day.
